contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Weapon |is_missile=yes |name = Zelzal-2 |image= |type = [[Artillery rocket]] |vehicle_range = {{convert|210|km|mi|abbr=on}} |fillings = one |launch_platform=Transporter erector launcher |yield = |engine = Solid |guidance = None |cep = |speed = |length = 16 m |diameter = 0.61 m |weight = 3,545 kg |payload_capacity = 600 kg |manufacturer = [[Iran]] |unit_cost = |service = 1993 |used_by = {{Flag|Iran}}<br>{{Flag|Syria}}<br>{{Flag|Lebanon}} ([[Hezbollah]]) }} '''Zelzal-2''' ([[Persian language|Persian]]: زلزال-۲, meaning "Earthquake") is an unguided <ref>[http://www.missilethreat.com/missilesoftheworld/id.177/missile_detail.asp Zelzal-1/2/3 at missilethreat.com]</ref> [[Iran]]ian 610 mm heavy artillery rocket that can carry a 600 kg (1,323 [[pound (mass)|lb]]) warhead an estimated {{convert|210|km|mi|abbr=on}}. The missile is thought to be based on the Soviet [[FROG-7]] missile,<ref>http://www.globalsecurity.org/wmd/world/iran/zelzal-2.htm</ref> with development begun in 1990.<ref>http://www.nti.org/e_research/profiles/Iran/Missile/3367_3397.html</ref> As of August 2006, it has been reported that Iran had supplied [[Hezbollah]] with Zelzal-2 missiles.<ref>http://www.strategypage.com/htmw/htweap/articles/20060804.aspx</ref> Similar claims had already been made in 2002<ref>http://www.nti.org/e_research/profiles/Iran/Missile/3367_3397.html</ref> but no proof has been found in subsequent years. It appears<ref>http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1154525807791&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull</ref> that, if there are indeed such missiles stationed in Lebanon, they are controlled by Iranian [[liaison officer]]s{{citation needed|date=June 2011}}. ==Operators== * {{Flag|Iran}} * {{Flag|Syria}}<ref>http://articles.janes.com/articles/Janes-Missiles-And-Rockets-2004/Iran-supplies-improved-rockets-to-Syria-and-Hizbullah.html</ref> * {{Flag|Lebanon}} ([[Hezbollah]])<ref>http://articles.janes.com/articles/Janes-Missiles-And-Rockets-2004/Iran-supplies-improved-rockets-to-Syria-and-Hizbullah.html</ref> - unconfirmed reports state about 500+ missiles and launchers ==See also== *[[Zelzal-1]] *[[Zelzal-3]] *[[Fateh-110]] *[[Military of Iran]] *[[Iran's missile forces]] *[[Iranian military industry]] *[[Equipment of the Iranian army]] ==References== {{Citation style|date=March 2012}} {{reflist}} {{Iran Military}} {{Iran Missiles}} [[Category:Weapons of Iran]] [[Category:Hezbollah rocket systems]] [[Category:Ballistic missiles of Iran]] {{Iran-mil-stub}} {{Weapon-stub}}
